revised_title: Endogenous Glucocorticoids and Nitric Oxide Production in Bacterial Endotoxin Response
tldr: The study investigates the role of endogenous glucocorticoids in regulating the production of nitric oxide and vasodilator prostaglandins in response to bacterial endotoxin in adrenalectomized rats. The results show that endogenous glucocorticoids help ameliorate the induction of nitric oxide synthase and cyclooxygenase in response to inflammatory stimuli such as cytokines or endotoxin, thus reducing the severity of circulatory shock.
